title: GIFT Nifty up 100 points; here's the trading setup for today's session
summary: Indian equity markets opened higher on Monday, buoyed by an interim India-US trade deal framework. Analysts suggest a gradual recovery and consolidation phase, with global factors, currency, and foreign fund flows dictating the near-term direction. The RSI shows a bullish trend, indicating potential upward movement.

title: Stocks in news: Titan, BSE, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Marico, Tata Motors PV
summary: Markets rallied on Monday, buoyed by global optimism and a potential India-US trade framework, with analysts eyeing a Nifty retest of 26,000. Several companies, including Titan and BSE, are in focus due to Q3 results and significant corporate developments.  Adani Energy secured financing for a green energy transmission project, while Marico made a strategic investment in a Vietnamese skincare entity.

title: Sebi plans to cut minimum SIF investment
summary: Sebi proposes to slash the minimum investment in social impact funds to ₹1,000 from ₹2 lakh, aiming to attract small investors and align with ZCZP instrument norms. The regulator also suggests extending NPO registration to three years and reducing ZCZP issuance subscription to 50% for certain projects.

title: Actis enters race to re-acquire Sprng Energy from Shell at $2 billion valuation
summary: Actis LLP is making a move to buy back Sprng Energy from Shell. This clean energy platform was originally set up by Actis. Other major players like Aditya Birla Group and KKR are also in the race. Final bids are expected soon. The deal could value Sprng Energy at up to $2 billion.

title: Jewellery stocks rally on back of US-India trade deal
summary: Gold jewellers stocks saw significant gains on Monday. This rally was driven by a US-India trade deal that reduced tariffs on jewellery exports. Strong financial results from companies like Kalyan Jewellers and P N Gadgil also boosted investor confidence. Demand from the wedding season is expected to continue this positive trend into the next quarter.

title: SBI logs biggest single-day gain in 19 months on strong Q3 results
summary: State Bank of India shares surged over 7%, marking its biggest single-day gain in 19 months following stronger-than-expected December quarter results. Analysts cited robust loan growth and outperformance against peers, leading to price target upgrades and bullish derivative positions, suggesting further upside potential.

title: Hillhouse set to buy 5% in Quest Global
summary: Asia-focused Hillhouse Investment Management is nearing a deal to acquire a 5% stake in Quest Global. The engineering services firm is valued at approximately $4.5 billion. This investment is part of Quest Global's pre-IPO fundraising. Singapore's Temasek may also secure a smaller stake. Quest Global is also considering a reverse flip to list on Indian stock exchanges.

title: Stock Radar: 15% rally in a month! Why Syrma SGS is back on bullish radar, Rajesh Palviya explains
summary: Syrma SGS Technology stock rallied over 15% in a month, reclaiming crucial moving averages and forming higher highs and lows, indicating a bullish trend. Experts suggest buying above Rs 880 for a target of Rs 950-960, citing a bullish Cup and Handle pattern and strong volume expansion.

title: India’s fast-growing economy to support banking sector stability: Moody’s
summary: India's banking sector outlook is stable. Moody's Ratings projects low non-performing assets. Robust economic growth will support the sector's fundamentals. Profitability is expected to remain stable. Loan growth will align with deposits. Banks are well-capitalised. Strong economic growth will support asset quality.

title: Areion Group wins Rs 936-crore bid for Aviom India Housing Finance despite higher Unity SFB offer
summary: Areion Group secured the winning bid for Aviom India Housing Finance. Secured lenders unanimously backed Areion's Rs 936-crore offer. This plan offers lenders a recovery of about 65%. Unity Small Finance Bank had placed a higher bid but with conditions. Lenders preferred Areion's unconditional offer for certainty of recovery.

title: Digital frauds drop as banks step up vigil
summary: Amid a wave of rising AI-generated frauds, banks and regulators are responding with strengthened security controls, multi-factor authentication, real-time fraud-monitoring systems and customer awareness campaigns. As a customer protection measure, the RBI in its February Monetary Policy announced compensation of up to Rs 25,000 for small-value payment frauds if the customers are genuinely cheated.

title: NHB pushes for lower home loan rates, lenders delay cuts till April
summary: The National Housing Bank is pushing housing finance companies to lower lending rates for customers.  However, these companies plan to wait until April for their internal benchmarks to be reset before making significant rate cuts.  Some lenders have already made minor reductions.  This move aims to pass on reduced borrowing costs to existing borrowers.

title: Kotak Mahindra Bank CTO Bhavnish Lathia resigns less than a year after appointment
summary: Kotak Mahindra Bank faces leadership churn as CTO Bhavnish Lathia resigns citing personal reasons for a US relocation, less than a year into his role. This follows a series of senior exits, including former CTO Milind Nagnur. Nilesh Chaudhari is now the new CTO, with Aravamudham Narayanan heading innovation and AI.

title: RBI allows gold, silver pledged voluntarily for collateral-free MSE loans
summary: The Reserve Bank of India has issued new guidelines for micro and small enterprises. Banks can now accept gold and silver as collateral for loans up to a certain limit. This move aims to support these businesses. Collateral-free loans will be available up to Rs 20 lakh. The revised rules apply from April 1, 2026.

title: Stocks to watch: Titan, Grasim, BSE, Marico among 10 shares in focus today; full list here
summary: Stock market today: On Monday, the Sensex advanced 485.35 points, or 0.58%, to end at 84,065.75, while the Nifty 50 rose 173.60 points, or 0.68%, to settle at 25,867.30.

title: Nifty 50, Sensex today: What to expect from Indian stock market in trade on February 10
summary: Nifty 50, Sensex today: The trends on Gift Nifty also indicate a strong start for the Indian benchmark index. The Gift Nifty was trading around 25,990 level, a premium of nearly 75 points from the Nifty futures’ previous close.

title: Indian stock market: 6 key things that changed for market overnight - Gift Nifty, Nikkei, Nasdaq rally to gold prices
summary: Gift Nifty was trading around 25,987 level, a premium of nearly 72 points from the Nifty futures’ previous close, indicating a positive start for the Indian stock market indices.

title: Five blue-chip auto stocks to add to your watchlist
summary: Market leaders, scale advantages, steady cash flows, these auto blue chips quietly compound as the cycle unfolds.

title: Gold, silver rates today: Gold and silver prices fall up to 2% after gaining for two days. What should investors do?
summary: Gold, silver rates today: Spot gold was down 0.70% to $5,040 per ounce, meanwhile, spot silver fell 1.94% to $80.33 per ounce, during the Asian trading hours on Tuesday.

title: Stocks to buy: Raja Venkatraman's recommends three stocks for 10 February
summary: Market expert Raja Venkatraman shares his three top stock picks to buy today, 10 February. Discover his exclusive picks and analysis to inform your investment strategy.

title: Stock recommendations for 10 February from MarketSmith India
summary: MarketSmith India reveals its top stock recommendations for today, 10 February. Get expert insights into the best-performing stocks to guide your investment decisions.

title: Amazon, Google and Microsoft to get tariff relief from Trump admin on chips for data centres, says report — What we know
summary: The Trump administration may give big tech players in the US, such as Microsoft, Google and Amazon tariff exemption on chips used for artificial intelligence data centres, FT reported. Here's what we know.

title: Bertelsmann Next enters India with acquisition of Let's Transport
summary: Germany's Bertelsmann Next has acquired an 80% stake in Let's Transport as it enters the Indian market. The investment platform aims to consolidate logistics through multiple acquisitions, focusing on long-term growth.

title: Samara Capital closes second fund with SMS Facility's sale to Norwest-backed SILA Solutions
summary: The private equity firm’s final exit from its 2014-vintage fund delivers a 25% gross IRR and comes as it works toward closing its third fund with growing domestic investor interest.

title: From Canada to Gadchiroli: Inside Tata Steel’s race to secure raw material after it loses legacy mines
summary: Tata Steel meets 100% of its iron ore requirements in India through six legacy mines allotted before the Mines and Minerals (Development and Regulation) Amendment Act, 2015.

title: JK Lakshmi Cement bets on capacity expansion to protect, grow market share amid industry-wide additions
summary: Despite a 23% drop in Q3 profit, JK Lakshmi is aggressively expanding its footprint in North, West and East India to prevent market share losses during peak demand cycles, when utilisation reaches 95%.

title: The Ulip paradox: Its tax perks come with unexpected long-term trade-offs.
summary: Ulips come with tax advantages, but from a structural standpoint, the product has limitations.

title: Gold price climbs ₹10 to ₹1,57,920; silver up ₹100, trading at ₹3,00,100
summary: The price of 22-carat gold decreased by ₹10, with ten grams of the yellow metal selling at ₹1,44,760

title: Auto sector momentum builds; MOFSL prefers TVS, Maruti Suzuki as top stocks
summary: India's auto sector starts 2026 with strong demand across PVs, 2Ws, CVs and tractors. MOFSL prefers TVS Motor and Maruti Suzuki.

title: Stocks picks, Feb 10: Kotak Sec recommends JSW Steel, Acutaas Chemicals
summary: Stocks to buy, Feb 10: JSW Steel offers strong volume growth and margin recovery potential, while Acutaas Chemicals benefits from robust CDMO-led earnings momentum, says Shrikant Chouhan of Kotak Sec
